intro: Haynaldia uranocoma, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, characterized by its hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Haynaldia uranocoma is often found in rocky soils and is a common component of desert ecosystems.
